derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the sense 'final point in space or time'): from Latin, end, limit, boundary'

entry.def: On a bus or train route, the terminus is the last stop, where the bus or train turns round or starts a journey in the opposite direction.

example.ex: ...the London terminus of the Channel Tunnel rail link.
example.tran: 英吉利海峡隧道连接铁路的伦敦终点站

means.word_mean: 1. a place where something ends or is complete
2. the ultimate goal for which something is done
3. (architecture) a statue or a human bust or an animal carved out of the top of a square pillar; originally used as a boundary marker in ancient Rome
4. either end of a railroad or bus route
5. station where transport vehicles load or unload passengers or goods

auth_sentence.content: Buses go from Vauxhall's shiny terminus.

auth_sentence.content: Juba's town square once served mainly as a transportation terminus.

stems_affixes.word_buile: determine[v.决心,决定;确定,限定]+ate……的→adj.确定的
determine[v.决心,决定;确定,限定]+ed……的→adj.下定了决心的
in无+termin界限;末端+able可以……的→没有界限的→无穷无尽的
determinate[adj.确定的]+ive表名词→n.决定之事, 限定词
termin界限;末端+al表名词→n.终点[站];终端
terminate[v.[使]结束,[使]停止]+ion表名词→n.终止,结束
termin界限;末端+ology学科→定出界限的学科→下定义→术语学
termin界限;末端+us→界限之点→终点
de加强+termin界限;末端+e→加强界限→确定
ex出+termin界限;末端+ate表动词→从界限中赶出来→根除
termin界限;末端+ate表动词→定出界限→终结

sentences.en: How much to the terminus, please?
